title: Simi Fehoko
text:
Simione Tufui Fehoko (born November 5, 1997) is an <a href="American%20football">American football</a> <a href="wide%20receiver">wide receiver</a> for the <a href="Dallas%20Cowboys">Dallas Cowboys</a> of the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> (NFL). He played <a href="college%20football">college football</a> at <a href="Stanford%20Cardinal%20football">Stanford</a>.
Early years.
Fehoko played football at <a href="Brighton%20High%20School%20%28Cottonwood%20Heights%2C%20Utah%29">Brighton High School</a> in <a href="Cottonwood%20Heights%2C%20Utah">Cottonwood Heights, Utah</a>. As a junior he led the state in receiving, posting 65 receptions for 1,656 yards and 24 receiving touchdowns (state record).
As a senior, he tallied 59 receptions for 1,495 yards and 16 receiving touchdowns. He was a two-time All-state selection and was named to the <a href="2015%20USA%20Today%20All-USA%20high%20school%20football%20team">2015 USA Today All-USA high school football second team</a>. He set the state record for career receiving yards (3,571) and career receiving touchdowns (41). He was a four star recruit coming out of high school and committed to <a href="Stanford%20University">Stanford University</a> to play <a href="college%20football">college football</a>.
Fehoko also <a href="Letterman%20%28sports%29">lettered</a> in <a href="basketball">basketball</a>.
College career.
After a two-year <a href="the%20Church%20of%20Jesus%20Christ%20of%20Latter-day%20Saints">LDS</a> <a href="Mormon%20missionary">mission</a> in <a href="Seoul">Seoul, Korea</a>, Fehoko began his freshman season in 2018. He played in the last 4 games as a backup, making one reception for 6 yards.
As a sophomore, he appeared in 12 games with one start. He registered 24 receptions for 566 yards (fourth on the team), a 23.58-yard average per reception (school record) and 6 receiving touchdowns (second on the team). He had 3 receptions for 97 receiving yards and 2 touchdowns against the <a href="University%20of%20Arizona">University of Arizona</a>. He made 3 receptions for 92 yard and 2 touchdowns against <a href="Washington%20State%20University">Washington State University</a>.
As a junior in 2020, the football season was reduced to 6 games due to the <a href="COVID-19%20pandemic%20in%20the%20United%20States">COVID-19 pandemic</a>. He played in all 6 games with 5 starts, leading the team with 37 receptions for 574 yards, a 15.5-yard average per reception and 3 touchdowns, while being named to the All-Pac-12 First Team. He had 6 receptions for 100 yards against <a href="Oregon%20State%20University">Oregon State University</a>. He tallied 16 receptions (school record), 230 receiving yards (third in school history) and 3 receiving touchdowns in the double-overtime win over <a href="UCLA">UCLA</a>, 48-47.
On August 28, 2020, he announced that he would forgo his senior season in order to enter the <a href="2021%20NFL%20Draft">2021 NFL Draft</a>. He finished his college career with 62 receptions for 1,146 yards, an 18.5-yard average per reception (third in school history), 9 receiving touchdowns and 77% of his total receptions (48) resulted in either a first down or a touchdown.
Professional career.
Fehoko was selected by the <a href="Dallas%20Cowboys">Dallas Cowboys</a> in the fifth round (179th overall) of the <a href="2021%20NFL%20Draft">2021 NFL Draft</a>. He signed his four-year rookie contract on May 13, 2021.
